quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Associative Arrays[/h1]

Remember that JavaScript [b]does not[/b] support arrays with named indexes.
In JavaScript, arrays always use numbered indexes.
It is better to use an [b]object [/b]when you want the index to be a [b]string[/b] (text).
Use an [b]array [/b]when you want the index to be a [b]number[/b].
[note]If you use a named index, JavaScript will redefine the array to a standard object.
[/note]
